Try the new restaurant coming soon in the new culinary building
Have fun and enjoy the college experience
All stars. This is an awesome school

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {303981=Whether yout witness the Greatest Spectacle in Racing in May at the Speedway, or visit the House That Peyton Built, Indianapolis is your one stop shop for sports, shopping, and dining, with pockets of greenery that let you unwind., 174836=Since I just started attending Ivy Tech for the Fall 2012 semester, I have not really heard of any unusual traditions or anything, yet., 386629=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 49798=there are plenty of locations in the downtown area to go to. since this is a community college, campus is usually dead after 10 o'clock., 264573=It is more challenging than college of the 70's and 80's. College is much more rigorous today then in the 70s and80s. I went to college in the 70s and 80s, and now again in 2013,and as a student today, the computers have made much more work, with quizes, tests, projects, discussions, and doing journals online can sometimes be overwhelming.}

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Financial adi is a privilage and their certain situations that can cause obsticals, such as, dropping a class so I wouldn't reccomend perfonrming this action Bang for the buck Less than a thousand dollars a course, books on an average cost about one hundred and twenty dollars so ofcourse you will get your bang for your buck Am enjoying being here I love being at Ivy Tech, because the crowd is diverse and everyone is mature with a destiny to obtain their degrees Am learning a lot the courses have on a average 25- 30 students, so there is always more than enough chance for everone to ask their questions and recieve answers. Also there are always working tutors willing to go beyond their tasks Login to rate or flag the reviews Samantha from Indianapolis, IN 07/23/2010 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 4 out of 5 people found this review useful.
